verses.verse: Then it happened<WH1961> when David<WH1732> and his men<WH376> came<WH935> to Ziklag<WH6860> on the third<WH7992> day,<WH3117> that the Amalekites<WH6003> had made<WH6584> a raid<WH6584> on the Negev<WH5045> and on Ziklag,<WH6860> and had overthrown<WH5221> Ziklag<WH6860> and burned<WH8313> it with fire;<WH784>

and they took<WH7617> captive<WH7628> the women<WH802> [and all] who<WH834> were in it, both<WH4480> small<WH9512> and great,<WH1419> without<WH3808> killing<WH4191> anyone,<WH376> and carried<WH5090> [them] off<WH5090> and went<WH1980> their way.<WH1870>

And when David<WH1732> and his men<WH376> came<WH935> to the city,<WH5892> behold,<WH2009> it was burned<WH8313> with fire,<WH784> and their wives<WH802> and their sons<WH1121> and their daughters<WH1323> had been taken<WH7617> captive.<WH7628>

Then David<WH1732> and the people<WH5971> who<WH834> were with him lifted<WH5375> their voices<WH6963> and wept<WH1058> until<WH5704> <WH834> there<WH369> was no<WH369> strength<WH3581> in them to weep.<WH1058>
Now David's two<WH8147> wives<WH802> had been taken<WH7617> captive,<WH7628> Ahinoam<WH293> the Jezreelitess<WH3159> and Abigail<WH26> the widow<WH802> of Nabal<WH5037> the Carmelite.<WH3761>

Moreover David<WH1732> was greatly<WH3966> distressed<WH9503> because<WH3588> the people<WH5971> spoke<WH559> of stoning<WH5619> him, for all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> were embittered,<WH4843> each<WH376> one<WH376> because<WH5921> of his sons<WH1121> and his daughters.<WH1323> But David<WH1732> strengthened<WH2388> himself in the Lord<WH3068> his God.<WH430>

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abiathar<WH54> the priest,<WH3548> the son<WH1121> of Ahimelech,<WH288> "Please<WH4994> bring<WH5066> me the ephod.<WH646>" So Abiathar<WH54> brought<WH5066> the ephod<WH646> to David.<WH1732>

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of the Lord,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> "Shall I pursue<WH7291> this<WH2088> band<WH1416>? Shall I overtake<WH5381> them?" And He said<WH559> to him, "Pursue,<WH7291> for you shall surely<WH5381> overtake<WH5381> them, and you shall surely<WH5337> rescue<WH5337> [all]."

So David<WH1732> went,<WH1980> he and the six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> who<WH834> were with him, and came<WH935> to the brook<WH5158> Besor,<WH1308> [where] those left<WH3498> behind<WH3498> remained.<WH5975>

But David<WH1732> pursued,<WH7291> he and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men,<WH376> for two hundred<WH3967> who<WH834> were too<WH4480> exhausted<WH6296> to cross<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Besor,<WH1308> remained<WH5975> [behind.]

Now they found<WH4672> an Egyptian<WH4713> in the field<WH7704> and brought<WH3947> him to David,<WH1732> and gave<WH5414> him bread<WH3899> and he ate,<WH398> and they provided<WH8248> him water<WH4325> to drink.<WH8248>

And they gave<WH5414> him a piece<WH6400> of fig<WH1690> cake<WH1690> and two<WH8147> clusters<WH6778> of raisins,<WH6778> and he ate;<WH398> then his spirit<WH7307> revived.<WH7725> For he had not eaten<WH398> bread<WH3899> or drunk<WH8354> water<WH4325> for three<WH7969> days<WH3117> and three<WH7969> nights.<WH3915>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to him, "To whom<WH4310> do you belong? And where<WH335> are you from?" And he said,<WH559> "I am a young<WH5288> man<WH5288> of Egypt,<WH4713> a servant<WH5650> of an Amalekite;<WH6003> and my master<WH113> left<WH5800> me behind<WH5800> when<WH3588> I fell<WH2470> sick<WH2470> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> ago.

"We made<WH6584> a raid<WH6584> on the Negev<WH5045> of the Cherethites,<WH3774> and on that which<WH834> belongs to Judah,<WH3063> and on the Negev<WH5045> of Caleb,<WH3612> and we burned<WH8313> Ziklag<WH6860> with fire.<WH784>"

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to him, "Will you bring<WH3381> me down<WH3381> to this<WH2088> band<WH1416>?" And he said,<WH559> "Swear<WH7650> to me by God<WH430> that you will not kill<WH4191> me or deliver<WH5462> me into the hands<WH3027> of my master,<WH113> and I will bring<WH3381> you down<WH3381> to this<WH2088> band.<WH1416>"

And when he had brought<WH3381> him down,<WH3381> behold,<WH2009> they were spread<WH5203> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the land,<WH776> eating<WH398> and drinking<WH8354> and dancing<WH2287> because of all<WH3605> the great<WH1419> spoil<WH7998> that they had taken<WH3947> from the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430> and from the land<WH776> of Judah.<WH3063>

And David<WH1732> slaughtered<WH5221> them from the twilight<WH5399> until<WH5704> the evening<WH6153> of the next<WH4283> day;<WH4283> and not a man<WH376> of them escaped,<WH4422> except<WH3588> <WH518> four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> young<WH5288> men<WH5288> who<WH834> rode<WH7392> on camels<WH1581> and fled.<WH1272>
So David<WH1732> recovered<WH5337> all<WH3605> that the Amalekites<WH6002> had taken,<WH3947> and rescued<WH5337> his two<WH8147> wives.<WH802>

But nothing<WH3808> of theirs<WH1992> was missing,<WH5737> whether<WH4480> small<WH9512> or<WH5704> great,<WH1419> sons<WH1121> or daughters,<WH1323> spoil<WH7998> or<WH5704> anything<WH3605> that they had taken<WH3947> for themselves;<WH1992> David<WH1732> brought<WH7725> [it] all<WH3605> back.<WH7725>

So David<WH1732> had captured<WH3947> all<WH3605> the sheep<WH6629> and the cattle<WH1241> [which the people] drove<WH5090> ahead<WH6440> of the [other] livestock,<WH4735> and they said,<WH559> "This<WH2088> is David's spoil.<WH7998>"

When David<WH1732> came<WH935> to the two hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> who<WH834> were too<WH4480> exhausted<WH6296> to follow<WH1980> <WH310> David,<WH1732> who had also been left<WH3427> at the brook<WH5158> Besor,<WH1308> and they went<WH3318> out to meet<WH7122> David<WH1732> and to meet<WH7122> the people<WH5971> who<WH834> were with him, then David<WH1732> approached<WH5066> the people<WH5971> and greeted<WH7592> <WH7965> them.

Then all<WH3605> the wicked<WH7451> and worthless<WH1100> men<WH376> among<WH4480> those who<WH834> went<WH1980> with David<WH1732> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> "Because<WH3282> <WH834> they did not go<WH1980> with us, we will not give<WH5414> them any<WH4480> of the spoil<WH7998> that we have recovered,<WH5337> except<WH3588> <WH518> to every<WH376> man<WH376> his wife<WH802> and his children,<WH1121> that they may lead<WH5090> [them] away<WH5090> and depart.<WH1980>"

Then David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "You must not do<WH6213> so,<WH3651> my brothers,<WH251> with what<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> has given<WH5414> us, who has kept<WH8104> us and delivered<WH5414> into our hand<WH3027> the band<WH1416> that came<WH935> against<WH5921> us.

"And who<WH4310> will listen<WH8085> to you in this<WH2088> matter<WH1697>? For as his share<WH2506> is who goes<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the battle,<WH4421> so shall his share<WH2506> be who stays<WH3427> by the baggage;<WH3627> they shall share<WH2505> alike.<WH9191>"
And so it has been<WH1961> from that day<WH3117> forward,<WH4605> that he made<WH7760> it a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance<WH4941> for Israel<WH3478> to this<WH2088> day.<WH3117>

Now when David<WH1732> came<WH935> to Ziklag,<WH6860> he sent<WH7971> [some] of the spoil<WH7998> to the elders<WH2205> of Judah,<WH3063> to his friends,<WH7453> saying,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> a gift<WH1293> for you from the spoil<WH7998> of the enemies<WH340> of the Lord: <WH3068>
to those who<WH834> were in Bethel,<WH1008> and to those who<WH834> were in Ramoth<WH7418> of the Negev,<WH7418> and to those who<WH834> were in Jattir,<WH3492>
and to those who<WH834> were in Aroer,<WH6177> and to those who<WH834> were in Siphmoth,<WH8224> and to those who<WH834> were in Eshtemoa,<WH851>

and to those who<WH834> were in Racal,<WH7403> and to those who<WH834> were in the cities<WH5892> of the Jerahmeelites,<WH3397> and to those who<WH834> were in the cities<WH5892> of the Kenites,<WH7017>
and to those who<WH834> were in Hormah,<WH2767> and to those who<WH834> were in Bor-ashan, and to those who<WH834> were in Athach,<WH6269>
